bow: mmr tomorrow hi all dd has mmr tomorrow and am so frightened that it will make her really ill have had pnd and ocd with intrusive thoughts about her safety and am really struggling with this know that am doing the right thing to keep her safe but it so hard when your brain is freaking you out how was your child after the mmr edit thanks guy it reassuring to hear that your little ones were ok everyone on this sub is really nice thanks for putting my mind at ease edit she was fine little cry but soon cheered up little red sore spot on her legs and bit cuddley but so far no temperature or anything again thank you for your responses they really helped my daughter cried for about five min then was still smiles again she did have any reaction except for her thigh was sore so we just avoided that spot for couple days talk to the doctor giving the shot about your concerns they gave me infant tylenol just in case she got fervor my son had his 10 days ago he cried for five seconds and then forgot all about it usually after he gets shot you can see exactly where he got it for at least few days but he did even have that this time pleasantly surprised as the others said few minutes of crying neither of my kids have had much reaction to any vaccines neither of my kids had any reaction other than being upset for few minutes at the most and little tenderness for day or so it okay to be worried kudos to you for going through with it anyway they do even know it coming then they re ok again in 30 seconds with some cuddles they get little sick afterward but in our little guy case he was actually easier to care for when sick he slept more and the doctor gave us dosage for tylenol wet washcloth on the head also helps it lot better they get little sick from shots than deathly ill from serious illness both completely fine had febrile seizure the day had my first mmr as child so second was delayed had my second before starting college with no problems keep motrin or tylenol on hand if they are grumpy no tears during minor fever and rash about days later we ve had the last problems with mmr compared to her other shots same with my daughter she never had bad reaction and would be all smiles by the time we got out to the car we always get ice cream afterwards too just in case all of ours had it no issues at all my kid was fine my son was fine he cried for less than minute his leg was little tender for day or two after but other than that he was good your baby will be just fine almost all kids are fine after vaccinations if you daughter has had adverse reactions to any other vaccinations she ll likely be the same with this one the only reason you should be concerned is if you have family history of bad reactions to vaccines and even then it may not affect her my mother had bad reactions febrile seizures so my vaccines where done in doses was fine my first child who has autoimmune issues and is on the autism spectrum as well as other neurological disorders had bad reactions to his 4th dtap though fine with the first and his first and only mmr which because of the other issues was delayed until he was as we were expecting reaction and he had to go straight to er with swollen face and trouble breathing he totally fine now at 13 my daughter never had any issues beyond swelling at the injection site for any of her vaccines including both doses of the mmr although we did skip prevnar pneumonia vaccine think because she is allergic to something used in the manufacture of that one it does sound like you have any family history or reason to worry beyond your ocd so please let this reassure you rather than further freak you out have you been seeing you therapist also remember how bad measles is and how much worse getting that disease will be for her than getting shot telling yourself that her likelihood of catching the disease may be higher than the likelihood that she will have an adverse reaction to the vaccination may help as well you could do detox bath for your little one when you guys get home epsom salts little coconut oil and lavender eo will sooth and relax no soap needed and the coconut oil with act as moisturizer give them little massage after careful to avoid the injection site there is lots on line about detox baths for kids and adults for that matter sure everything will be fine but that might make you feel better more proactive it really no biggie while negative reactions are possible they re unlikely and usually very mild depending on how old your daughter is there are several things you can do to make it easier firstly *you* should be as relaxed as possible going in if you re nervous wreck your kid will pick up on it and freak out as well if your kid is getting the 2nd shot between yrs old you should let her know what going to happen but do make big deal about it whether you re dealing with yr old or yr old small dose of advil about 30 minutes ahead of time can help if you re still nursing you can be ready to nurse immediately after the shot or you can even ask the nurse to give the shot while you re nursing we did that and sometimes my kid barely noticed it if your girl is older you can have sucker on hand and give that to her immediately before the shot studies have shown that kids who are given sugar while they get shot report feeling less pain my daughter got hers at 12 months we had measles outbreak in our area so was very happy for her to be getting that shot she cried during the shot obviously but afterwards did have any issues other than sore spot on her leg that lasted few days helluva lot better than getting measles forbid yourself from from googling any more on this tonight everything is going to be fine and researching it any more at this point wo help calm your fears since only people who feel strongly on the issue post online tomorrow come back and let us know how it went sure you ll be fine three kids checking in it sucks while they re getting the shot of course but none of mine had any reactions my youngest has lot of allergies and tends to react to random things right now he chillin in an oatmeal bath because he has mystery hives on his buns even he had no reaction mine was trooper though it tiny bit of tears and then back to normal about 14 days later he got non itchy rash for few days this can be side effect and was big deal think we got the mmr shot and the varicella shot at the same time he cried for couple minutes immediately afterward and he ran low grade fever for couple days afterward that was the extent of it it will most likely be just like every other shot your baby has had so far good luck tomorrow one if you re getting the shot and you ve made up your mind no more google for your sanity two there are two kinds mmr and mmrv if vaccinations so know which one you want prior to going in ours was going to give the mmrv but decided on just the mmr third if baby does have reaction report it to vaers google it later my girl cried and had terrible excema flair up but no temperature vomiting or anything of the like thank you for your reply could live with myself if she got one of thes awful diseases through my cowardice because it would be me giving in and pandering to my own fears to leave her unprotected it great to hear so many positive stories thank you for your reply am well stocked up with calpol and cool cloths in preparation will certainly talk to the doctor before hand thank you may try the icecream bribe too thank you for your reply will keep my fingers crossed for jab like your little ones thank you for your reply oh yes well stocked up with calpol oh agree with you all the way not to give her it would be selfish and irresponsible one of my daughters got sick around week after she felt bad and had to stay home from daycare due to fever and rash it was way better than getting any of the real viruses though thank you for your reply will stay away from google it bit silly to bother at this point like you said will certainly edit tomorrow and let you know how it goes thank you for your reply am keeping my fingers crossed for this she has been great with all her others thank you for your reply it great to know that your ok even after reaction like that well stocked up on paracetamol in readiness thank you for your reply she is getting the mmr and pertussis and hib boosters think yes no more google shall ban myself until after will look it up afterwards and keep my fingers crossed for an experienced like your little girl thank you for your reply and the luck thank you for your reply am hoping that she is as good with this one as all her others thank you for your reply will keep look out for rash thank you for your reply aw bless it reassuring to hear that as she has been fine with her others hope it goes well hope the thread helped settle some fear thank you for your reply oh yes definitely lot better than any of these diseases thank you for your reply she is 14 months and is still nursing but she has fondness for mini milk lollipops so will give her one of those to suck on what good suggestion good luck you have great mama instincts prayers for no reactions for your baby thank you for your reply she has been fine with her others if little sleepy but hear that that normal no its just me working myself up over it was actually discharged couple of weeks ago so no where near as bad as it would have been thank goodness will definitely bear that in mind it great to hear so many kids are ok thank you for your reply it so reassuring to hear that so many little ones are ok after it really put my mind at ease thanks for the reply am hoping she is too thank you for your reply am hoping that she is the same my baby got the shot on time she grew up to be the cutest most well spoken kindest most happy and dance loving year old yours will be fine *hug~ it seems that you might feel better if you stop hanging out with antivaxx fear mongers edit when my daughter was she got her last shot next one not till years old we went to the pharmacy store together to buy the vaccine we picked out few pieces of bulk gummies she was told exactly what we are doing then we went to the doctor together she had the option to choose thigh or arm she chose thigh she did have tear in her eye and made sad noise but recognised that she is now protected against few more diseases dr gave her sticker and gave her gummy as promised she smiled and thanked the doctor we came home no fever no illness no bad dreams thank you for your reply she certainly loves her baths although can not put essential oils in due to me having bad eczema on my hands she likes baby massage though when use ordinary olive oil good for my hands too it really has thank you for your reply aw that so lovely to hear she rreally loves mini milk lollipops so will have one of them to hand it so reassuring to hear so many good experiences oh yeah no problem hope it goes well for your little one lot of the time they feed off our emotions try your best to be confidential and happy and not scared feel free to ask the doctor to explain what she is doing before it happens your welcome although for the life of me do understand the down votes just thought something proactive might help you cope with hard day we do eo in diffuser lot so you could always try that no reaction at all not even bump or redness at the site which is common whimpered for just sec then gave me high minute later the mommy fear struggle is real just told my best friend that pretty sure becoming mother makes you insane everything is danger all of the sudden still check to make sure my ten year old is breathing some nights because so afraid he will stop breathing in his sleep think that these irrational fears happen to the best of us and it is how we handle them that counts you are seriously doing great my last kid did even cry you would never know he even gotten shot nothing seriously forgot about it my son had no reaction he received his mmr booster at 18 months instead of years old as well my baby was totally fine always just little sleepy after any vaccination event hope you are ok not sure why you ve been downvoted epsom salt baths are commonly recommended for babies after shots because people are ugly or because suggesting detox bath acknowledges that there are chemicals to detox from and god forbid anyone say anything against vaccinations
